result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Roger Madland

records.addlTxt:
9:20 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Christopher Roger Madland in court.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM466 and 22CM469. DE would like to represent himself. Court notes Waiver of Counsel previously filed in 22CM469. DE wishes to waive counsel on both matters. ADA Rockow states a pro se offer will be sent. DE updates address and states phone number on file is not his. Court sets PSC. DE doesn't drive and has to get rides to appear in court. DE requests case be dismissed. Court denies request.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Roger Madland
Current: N8025 510th St, Spring Valley, WI 54767 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2022)
Prior: 2088 30Th Ave, Baldwin, WI 54002
Filed by DA Karn W. arc

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, 2088 30th Avenue, Baldwin, WI .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:58 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA: Michael Becker  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today  Defendant Christopher Roger Madland appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE will need to contact PD to see if he qualifies for their services. DE states he will not be hiring an atty. Bond argument. NG. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC with DA and PSC.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Settlement conference on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
